results.title: ‘My Cousin Vinny’ at 30: An Unlikely Oscar Winner
results.abstract: Much like Vinny in the South, the film was a fish out of water at the Academy Awards. But the comedy endures, thanks to a generous Joe Pesci and a fiery Marisa Tomei.

multimedia.caption: Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei in the courtroom in “My Cousin Vinny.”
Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei in the courtroom in “My Cousin Vinny.”
Joe Pesci and Marisa Tomei in the courtroom in “My Cousin Vinny.”

results.title: How to Watch the Critics Choice Awards 2022: Date, Time and Streaming
results.abstract: It could be a big night for “Belfast” and “West Side Story” — and might finally bring some clarity to the best actress race at the Oscars.

multimedia.caption: Taye Diggs was host of the awards in 2021. He’ll be back with Nicole Byer this year.

results.title: Oscar Rewind: When Rita Moreno Made History and Thanked No One
results.abstract: The actress explains why she gave one of the shortest Academy speeches ever when she became the first Latina to win an acting Oscar 60 years ago.

multimedia.caption: Rita Moreno with the Oscar statuette she didn’t expect to win.
Rita Moreno with the Oscar statuette she didn’t expect to win.
Rita Moreno with the Oscar statuette she didn’t expect to win.

results.title: ‘Encanto’ May Be Accurate, but Can It Carry a Whole Country?
results.abstract: The filmmakers behind the Disney hit worked for cultural accuracy. Some Colombians and Colombian Americans are looking for more.

multimedia.caption: The Madrigal family in “Encanto.” The filmmakers convened experts to get the Colombian details correct.
The Madrigal family in “Encanto.” The filmmakers convened experts to get the Colombian details correct.
The Madrigal family in “Encanto.” The filmmakers convened experts to get the Colombian details correct.

results.title: ‘Turning Red’ Review: Beware the Red-Furred Monster
results.abstract: A 13-year-old girl becomes a red panda when she loses her cool in Domee Shi’s heartwarming but wayward coming-of-age film.

multimedia.caption: Meilin (voiced by Rosalie Chiang), right, with her mother, Ming (Sandra Oh), in “Turning Red.”
Meilin (voiced by Rosalie Chiang), right, with her mother, Ming (Sandra Oh), in “Turning Red.”
Meilin (voiced by Rosalie Chiang), right, with her mother, Ming (Sandra Oh), in “Turning Red.”

results.title: Alec Baldwin Seeks to Avoid Liability in Fatal ‘Rust’ Shooting
results.abstract: In an arbitration demand against his fellow producers on the film, he denied culpability in the killing of a cinematographer and said he should not be held financially responsible.
results.byline: By Graham Bowley and Julia Jacobs

multimedia.caption: The church set in New Mexico where Alec Baldwin shot and killed the cinematographer Halyna Hutchins with a gun he had been told held no live ammunition.
The church set in New Mexico where Alec Baldwin shot and killed the cinematographer Halyna Hutchins with a gun he had been told held no live ammunition.
The church set in New Mexico where Alec Baldwin shot and killed the cinematographer Halyna Hutchins with a gun he had been told held no live ammunition.

results.title: Skewering the Anxious Young Things
results.abstract: The film “All My Friends Hate Me” satirizes anxiety and paranoia among upper-class British millennials. Its writers say they are laughing at themselves most of all.

multimedia.caption: In “All My Friends Hate Me,” Pete (Tom Stourton) becomes increasingly convinced his birthday weekend is not a normal celebration.
In “All My Friends Hate Me,” Pete (Tom Stourton) becomes increasingly convinced his birthday weekend is not a normal celebration.
In “All My Friends Hate Me,” Pete (Tom Stourton) becomes increasingly convinced his birthday weekend is not a normal celebration.

results.title: Al Pacino on ‘The Godfather’: ‘It’s Taken Me a Lifetime to Accept It and Move On’
results.abstract: Fifty years later, the actor looks back on his breakthrough role: how he was cast, why he skipped the Oscars and what it all means to him now.

multimedia.caption: Al Pacino as Michael Corleone. He won the role over Paramount’s objections.
Al Pacino as Michael Corleone. He won the role over Paramount’s objections.

results.title: How Well Do You Know ‘The Godfather’? The Quiz Nobody Asked For
results.abstract: Accept this quiz as a gift for the film’s 50th anniversary.

results.title: ‘Ultrasound’ Review: Trapped in a Murky Mystery

results.title: ‘Playing in the FM Band’ Review: A Free-Form Radio Legend
results.abstract: The trailer for this documentary shows today’s New Yorkers saying they had never heard of Steve Post. The film itself tries to make a case that they ought to have.
des_facet: Playing in the FM Band: The Steve Post Story (Movie)

results.title: ‘Last Exit: Space’ Review: Not-So-Final Frontiers
results.abstract: The director Rudolph Herzog, with his father, Werner Herzog, narrating, explores the feasibility of off-world colonization.

results.title: Who Will Win This Year’s Wild Best Actress Race?
results.abstract: There are cases to be made for and against every contender, and no one has an obvious advantage in this upended season.

results.title: Cities and States Are Easing Covid Rules. Should the Arts Follow?
results.abstract: Cultural institutions face tough decisions: Is it safe to drop mask and vaccine requirements, and would doing so be more likely to lure audiences back or keep them away?

multimedia.caption: Broadway is planning to keep its mask and vaccine requirements through at least the end of April. A masked crowd applauded “Hadestown” in September.

results.title: ‘The Godfather’ Explained in Seven Quotes
results.abstract: The film’s lines have become part of our collective memory. Seven writers, directors and actors look back at the movie and what these words mean to them.

multimedia.caption: Richard Castellano, left, as Clemenza, opposite John Martino as Paulie Gatto.
Richard Castellano, left, as Clemenza, opposite John Martino as Paulie Gatto.

results.title: With ‘The Godfather,’ Art Imitated Mafia Life. And Vice Versa.
results.abstract: Federal wiretaps and Mob insiders suggest that many real-life wiseguys turned to the 1972 film for inspiration, validation and cues on how to speak and act and dress.
des_facet: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

results.title: Taylor Tomlinson: A Comic With the Confidence of a Star
results.abstract: On her new Netflix special, “Look at You,” she demonstrates tight joke writing, carefully honed act-outs and a ruthless appetite for laughs.

multimedia.caption: Taylor Tomlinson in “Look at You”: it starts slowly but builds, thanks to some superb bits.

results.abstract: This documentary follows Ruth Finley to shows and tributes as she reluctantly brings her decades-long career to a close.

results.title: At the Oscar Nominees Luncheon: Glamour, Griping and Gluten-Free Meals
results.abstract: At the annual event for nominees and their guests, everyone was happy to be meeting face to face, but the plan to pretape several awards on Oscar night was a sore subject.

results.title: How the ‘Encanto’ Soundtrack Became a Smash
results.abstract: With its eighth week at No. 1 on Billboard’s album chart, the LP featuring songs from Lin-Manuel Miranda is a lesson in how fans drive hits from social media to streaming services.

multimedia.caption: Since its release, the “Encanto” album has had the equivalent of just under one million sales in the United States.
Since its release, the “Encanto” album has had the equivalent of just under one million sales in the United States.

results.title: With ‘Turning Red,’ a Big Red Panda Helps Break a Glass Ceiling
results.abstract: Domee Shi is the first woman filmmaker with sole directing credit on a Pixar feature.

results.abstract: A new production of Stephen Sondheim’s “Merrily We Roll Along” is to be staged late this year by the nonprofit New York Theater Workshop in the East Village.

results.title: ‘The Batman’ Opens With Blockbuster Ticket Sales
results.abstract: The movie took in nearly $250 million worldwide. In some domestic theaters, it was about $1 more for standard “Batman” tickets than for other movies.

multimedia.caption: Overseas, “The Batman,” which has a nearly three-hour run time, collected an additional $120 million, according to Comscore.
Overseas, “The Batman,” which has a nearly three-hour run time, collected an additional $120 million, according to Comscore.

results.title: ‘Mockingbird’ Made Her a Child Star. Now She’s in the Broadway Tour.
results.abstract: Six decades after she played Scout in the film version of “To Kill a Mockingbird,” Mary Badham takes on the role of a neighbor in the play’s national tour.

multimedia.caption: In the 1962 film, Badham was 10 years old when she played Scout opposite Gregory Peck as Atticus Finch.
In the 1962 film, Badham was 10 years old when she played Scout opposite Gregory Peck as Atticus Finch.

results.abstract: The film’s director and co-writer talks about the tumultuous conclusion and its chilling parallels to the real world. Read this after you’ve seen the movie.

results.title: With ‘Lucy and Desi,’ Amy Poehler Gets to the Heart of a Marriage
results.abstract: The performer and director wanted to deliver a down-to-earth portrayal of a couple whose union was far from perfect, even if viewers wouldn’t accept that.

results.title: Akaash Singh and His Case for Bringing Back Apu
results.abstract: The stand-up comic, whose special has gone viral, takes issue with how some South Asians like Hari Kondabolu portray their experience in the United States.
